sec.p: As an alternative approach to increasing wild hilsa production, the MoFL has been supporting the exploration of pond culture (not found to be economically viable) and cage culture, which has had limited success ( Puvanendran et al., 2013; Sahoo et al., 2016). Captive breeding techniques are also being explored to supplement the natural population levels through ‘hatch and release’ ( BOBLME, 2014).
